summary: This document is a chain of emails from September 2021 between federal prosecutors and law enforcement regarding outreach to a potential witness who was Ghislaine Maxwell's assistant. The emails discuss scheduling a conversation, confirming contact was made, and the preparation of an FBI 302 report based on the interview.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the prosecution; her former assistant is being contacted as a potential witness.

events.title: Email coordination about witness contact
events.description: Prosecutors and law enforcement coordinate via email about having connected with Ghislaine Maxwell's former assistant, who is a potential witness. Notes and a drafted FBI 302 report are mentioned.

events.title: Initial connection with potential witness
events.description: An FBI Special Agent reports having just connected with the potential witness (Maxwell's former assistant) and schedules a conversation for the following night.

events.title: Witness initial outreach
events.description: A person claiming to be Ghislaine Maxwell's former assistant reaches out to prosecutors via email and voicemail, stating they may have information to help the prosecution.

keyFacts: A person identifying as Ghislaine Maxwell's former assistant contacted prosecutors in July 2021 offering information for the prosecution.
By September 2021, law enforcement had made contact with this individual and an interview was conducted.
An FBI 302 report based on the interview with the assistant was written and awaiting serialization as of September 22, 2021.
The email chain shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY), the FBI, and the NYPD regarding this witness.
The potential witness reportedly lived with the assistant ('Kindness Matters') while she was working for Maxwell.
